item.title: What Is a Digital Twin? How Agentic Decisions Are Reshaping the Supply Chain
item.description:
1. The Emergence of the Supply Chain Digital Twin

In the intricate, globally distributed machinery of international trade and logistics, visibility has historically been the primary operational bottleneck. For decades, supply chain managers have relied on fragmented dashboards, delayed Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) messages, and manual updates to track the movement of goods. However, as global trade networks grow exponentially more complex and resilient logistics become a board-level imperative, merely seeing a delayed shipment or a low inventory alert is no longer sufficient. Enter the Digital Twinâ€”a concept that is fundamentally altering how organizations interact with physical reality.
